results.title: La Bamba (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Columbia, New Visions Pictures, Taylor Hackford and Luis Valdez
results.brief_description: Musical biography of Ritchie Valens, a poor Mexican-American who became a rock’n’roll sensation at age 17 in the 1950’s. Lou Diamond Phillips portrays Valens whose musical career ended when he was killed in the plane crash that also claimed the life of Buddy Holly. The music of Valens is performed by Los Lobos on the soundtrack.

results.title: L.A. Story
results.creator_credit: Daniel Melnick, Indieprod, L. A. Films and Mick Jackson
results.brief_description: Steve Martin wrote this romantic comedy, in which he stars as Harris K. Telemacher, a Los Angeles wacky weatherman extraordinaire. After growing increasingly distanced from his socialite girlfriend Trudi (Marilu Henner) and unhappy with his job, he finds his spirit renewed by the arrival of a British journalist (Victoria Tennant). An oddball, but very amusing look at the faux pas and foibles of life in modern Los Angeles.

results.title: L.A. confidential [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Regency Enterprises, Arnon Milchan, Curtis Hanson and Michael Nathanson
results.brief_description: Based on a James Ellroy novel, ‘L.A. Confidential’ perfectly recreates the mythology of film noir embedded within the city of Los Angeles circa 1950. Stylishly melding real and imagined Hollywood and crime folklore, the complex plot involves hookers that are made up to look like movie stars, corrupt cops on the take, sleazy tabloid journalists and of course, murder. Russell Crowe is excellent as the brutish but honest cop who teams up with an opportunistic rookie (Guy Pearce), and a smooth, star struck police officer (Kevin Spacey), to solve the gang style murder of a group of innocent bystanders in a late night diner. The investigation uncovers a sinister web of blackmail, sex and greed, implicating some of the upper echelons of L.A. society. No noir film would be complete without the obligatory femme fatale, played with sultry poise by Kim Basinger who won an Oscar for her performance. Rather than it being mere pastiche, director Curtis Hanson treats the material in a direct, earnest fashion and in doing so delivers one of the best examples of the genre for some time. Cast also includes Danny DeVito, David Strathairn and James Cromwell.

results.title: L'Atalante
results.creator_credit: Argui-Films, Gaumont-British Instructional, Jacques Louis-Nounez and Jean Vigo
results.brief_description: This simple love story involves a young barge skipper who installs his new wife on his barge which he works with an older man, Jules. The marriage falters and the wife deserts him in Paris. The film’s reputation and influence stems from the way Vigo injects an imaginary dream-like quality into more conventional passages of lyricism and the direct portrayal of working class life. In contrast to the couple the exotic, tattooed figure of Jules was a focus for Vigo. The intensity of the emotions and the strangeness of the images has been variously labelled ‘poetic realism’ and ‘surreal lyricism’. Cast includes Michel Simon, Dita Parlo and Jean Daste. In French with English subtitles. This restored version includes an additional 8 min. of footage.

results.title: Krull
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Ron Silverman and Peter Yates
results.brief_description: Set in the fantastic kingdom of Krull, our plot starts with the revelation that the kingdom is under threat from the indescribable Beast and his army of Slayers. Eager to forge an alliance, Prince Colwyn (Ken Marshall) and Princess Lyssa (Lysette Anthony) plan to marry. During the wedding ceremony however, slayers attack, killing Colwyn’s father and kidnapping Lyssa and taking her to the black fortress. Waking to discover he has lost his father and his bride, Colwyn is advised by the wise Ynyr that he must retrieve the Glaive - a starfish shaped, jewel encrusted symbol with retractable blades - which, given the right bearer, is the only thing that can defeat the Beast. Colwyn recruits a motley crew of renegades (including reputable actors such as Liam Neeson and Bernard Bresslaw), to accompany him on his quest. A curious blend of science fiction and medieval iconography, “Krull” has all the resident tenets of a fantasy; damsel in distress, love that can cure all evil, an almighty quest and final showdown between hero and villain. Whilst receiving a G classification, there are a few ghoulish moments which belie the general rating. Made on a budget in excess of 45 million, the film received cult rather than commercial success. Written by Stanford Sherman.

results.title: Kramer vs. Kramer [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Stanley R. Jaffe and Robert Benton
results.brief_description: A sensitive drama revolving around the relationship between a single father and his young son. Dustin Hoffman plays Ted Kramer, a career-driver husband and father who returns home from work one evening to be told by his wife (Meryl Streep) that she is leaving him and their six year old son. Initially overwhelmed by the responsibility of juggling a career and the care of his son, he gradually adapts to the role of single parent. When his wife returns after a period of soul searching, Ted challenges her right to custody. Based on the novel by Avery Corman. Also stars Justin Henry and Jane Alexander. Cinematography by Nestor Almendros. (Academy Awards: Best picture, Best actor, Best supporting actress, Best cinematography, Best direction, Best screenplay)

results.title: Koyaanisqatsi [DVD]
results.creator_credit: I R E and Godfrey Reggio
results.brief_description: Ko-Yaa-Nis-Katsi (from the Hopi language) is a panoramic roller coaster of life that makes you scream but hang on. A spellbinding, staggering non-narrative film that soars across the United States in search of vistas both natural and man-made. Much of the photography is in slow motion and time-lapse edited in such away as to produce an entirely different perspective to everyday reality. With cinematography by Ron Fricke and mesmerising music by Philip Glass, the film juxtaposes distortion with truth producing quite often alarming results. It is divided into five segments as follows: 1. Crazy life. 2. Life in turmoil. 3. Life out of balance. 4. Life disintegrating. 5. A state of life that calls for another way of living. Also available on VHS [307953]

results.title: Kolya
results.creator_credit: Biograf Jan Sverak, Portobello Pictures, Ceska televize, Pandora Cinema, Eric Abraham and Jan Sverak
results.brief_description: Louka is a middle-aged Czech who loves women, hates the idea of commitment and owes more money than he can earn playing the cello in a funeral orchestra. When a friend suggests he make a little ‘easy money’ by entering into an arranged marriage, with a Russian woman seeking citizenship, Louka reluctantly agrees. But it’s a decision that will throw his life into chaos…and change it forever. When the marriage is completed his new ‘wife’ is on the first plane to Germany leaving behind her five year old son for Louka to care for. So now this confirmed bachelor must become a father.. this grumpy old man and an innocent kid must learn to live together, even though they don’t speak the same language. This is a funny, touching and unforgettable story that will touch your heart. Winner of the Academy Award for Best Foreign Film. Contains Czech and Russian language with English subtitles.

results.title: Knights of the Round Table
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Pandro S. Berman and Richard Thorpe
results.brief_description:
Based on Sir Thomas Malory’s “Le Morte D’Arthur”, this is a tale of chivalry, honour, tragic love and intrigue. At the famous Round Table, established by Arthur to uphold peace, justice and chivalry, sits the gallant Lancelot, Percival and the evil Modred, consort to Arthur’s half-sister, Morgan Le Fay, who is determined to snatch the crown and bring chaos to the realm. The powerful Merlin can do nothing to circumvent the futile love between Lancelot and Queen Guinevere, the consequences of which will not only split the kingdom, but destroy the friendship between the King and his most trusted Knight. All the pageantry and splendour of the age are here.
Cast includes: Robert Taylor, Ava Gardner, Mel Ferrer, Anne Crawford, Stanley Baker and Felix Aylmer.
